intro: Spiesia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its smooth, succulent stems and alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its showy, yellowish flowers are clustered in inflorescences called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Spiesia macrocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
